result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Violate/Harassment Restraining Order - Temporary Restraining Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Armando A. Silva

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Heather.
Case Called: 10:10 a.m. 
State appears by DDA Molly Lawrence in person. Defendant appears in person, pro se. 
Date and time set for a judicial pre-trial.
VRCW. 

COURT questions Deft re: counsel.
Defendant still plans on getting counsel.
DDA Lawrence notes Deft qualifies for SPD but counsel has not been appointed yet. 
COURT instructs Deft to visit SPD after this hearing to check on the status of counsel.
Parties in agreement to leave dates on.

Adjourned: 10:13 a.m.

Judicial Pretrial - in court on October 27, 2022 at 10:10 am.
Jury status hearing on December 19, 2022 at 04:10 pm.
Jury trial - 6 person on January 11, 2023 at 09:00 am.

State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence; Defendant appears by phone - has not contacted PD.  Advised defendant to do so.
DATES: 
Keep on

Pre-trial conference on September 26, 2022 at 02:40 pm.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on October 27, 2022 at 10:10 am.
Jury status hearing on December 19, 2022 at 04:10 pm.
Jury trial - 6 person on January 11, 2023 at 09:00 am.

No contact with victim(s): A.K. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.

Defendant to sign bond within the next week.

Clerk: Amanda.
Case called at 2:55 pm.
State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck.  Deft appears pro se. 
Date and Time set for IA; VRCW. 

Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 

PLEA:  NOT GUILTY. 

COURT ORDERS: $500 signature bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s):  A.K. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
- Prints and photograph. 

Defendant to sign bond within the next week.
